title: Roy Keane orders Ed Woodward to sign Harry Kane for Man Utd
text:
Roy Keane suggests Manchester United should sign Harry Kane from Tottenham (Sky Sports)

Roy Keane has urged Ed Woodward to sign Harry Kane to solve Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s striker shortage at Manchester United.

Solskjaer has already admitted that he is keen to recruit a new forward in the January transfer window and concedes that he is light in attack after allowing Romelu Lukaku to leave Old Trafford in the summer.

After United’s 1-1 draw with Liverpool on Sunday, Gary Neville and Graeme Souness were involved in a heated debate over which striker United should target in January.

But Keane cut across the arguments with a staggeringly simple suggestion.

"Go and get Kane from Spurs, it's easy. What are you all staring at?" 😳 Roy Keane's simple answer to #MUFC's striker situation was to go and sign Harry Kane. ✍️ pic.twitter.com/8HOygIN02a — Sky Sports Premier League (@SkySportsPL) October 20, 2019

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Just go and get Kane from Spurs, easy,’ said the former United captain.

‘Just go and get him. What are you all staring at?

‘They’re in disarray, go and get him.’

Harry Kane has been linked with a move to Old Trafford (Getty Images)

Neville, meanwhile, believes United should be targeting a ‘mobile’ striker to suit Solskjaer’s style of play.

‘It won’t be a gamble in January as United need to go into the transfer market at the earliest opportunity because they obviously didn’t replace Lukaku,’ said Neville.

‘Those young lads out there – Pereira, McTominay, Wan-Bissaka, Rashford – they have to still buy to a style of play. There would be no point signing a replacement for Lukaku that’s the same type.

‘I don’t feel they want to play that way. They have to sign a striker to suit their style.

‘Liverpool play with three mobile strikers with Firmino who does a brilliant job, even when he’s not going to get you 25 goals a season. You can find a striker that fits the style of play.

‘I don’t feel Solskjaer is looking for a Lukaku type or a [Diego] Costa. He wants to play a more mobile three or front two.’
